description.plain:
Bea Miller is an American singer-songwriter who received initial popularity during the second season of X Factor USA. She finished in 9th place and subsequently signed to Hollywood Records and Syco Music in 2013. She cites Nirvana and Miley Cyrus as influences on her music.

She released the Young Blood EP in April 2014, which featured tracks later released on her 2015 full length, debut album Not An Apology, which peaked at No. 7 on the Billboard 200 album chart. Both releases spawned the Hot-100 charting single “Fire N Gold”, and it’s predecessor “Young Blood.”

In 2016 she released a non-album single “Yes Girl”, originally written for her second album. She was also a supporting act on Selena Gomez' “Revival” Tour.

In 2017 Miller released three EP’s over the course of the year – chapter one: blue, chapter two: red, and chapter three: yellow. Each EP contained three tracks fitting to certain themes. Blue reflected on sadness endured during “the roughest period of her life so far”, red reflected on her not wanting to feel sorry for herself, sad and angry. Yellow reflected on moving on past the issues. Each of the nine songs were reportedly set to appear on her second studio album.

2018 finally saw the announcement and release of  her second album aurora, which was supported by the singles “song like you” and “S.L.U.T.”

body.plain:
Bea Miller is an American singer-songwriter who received initial popularity during the second season of X Factor USA. She finished in 9th place and subsequently signed to Hollywood Records and Syco Music in 2013. She cites Nirvana and Miley Cyrus as influences on her music.

She released the Young Blood EP in April 2014, which featured tracks later released on her 2015 full length, debut album Not An Apology, which peaked at No. 7 on the Billboard 200 album chart. Both releases spawned the Hot-100 charting single “Fire N Gold”, and it’s predecessor “Young Blood.”

In 2016 she released a non-album single “Yes Girl”, originally written for her second album. She was also a supporting act on Selena Gomez' “Revival” Tour.

In 2017 Miller released three EP’s over the course of the year – chapter one: blue, chapter two: red, and chapter three: yellow. Each EP contained three tracks fitting to certain themes. Blue reflected on sadness endured during “the roughest period of her life so far”, red reflected on her not wanting to feel sorry for herself, sad and angry. Yellow reflected on moving on past the issues. Each of the nine songs were reportedly set to appear on her second studio album.

2018 finally saw the announcement and release of  her second album aurora, which was supported by the singles “song like you” and “S.L.U.T.”

songs.title: ​like that

description.plain:
Although not released as a single, but a track that eventually became a fan favourite, “Like That” see’s Bea confronting her partner for not treating her with the respect she deserves.

Over slick, pulsing synths, Bea begins to pick her self up the ground, understanding that becoming more independent will only make her stronger. All as apart of her efforts in her  sophomore album aurora to find herself after a toxic relationship.

“like that” was produced by Jarrad Rogers & Dreamlab, who wrote the track with Bea Miller. The track originally appeared on chapter 2: red, the second of three chapters that preceeded “auroras” release.

The song is also part of the soundtrack of the movie After which was released in 2019

songs.embed_content: Read “​like that” by Bea Miller on Genius

songs.title: S.L.U.T.

description.plain:
S.L.U.T.—"Sweet Little Unforgettable Thing"—is the second track off of Bea Miller’s chapter three: yellow EP. The track eventually went on to become the official lead single of her sophomore album aurora. This song, inspired by an Instagram hater, is full of self-love and body-positivity messages.

The music video dropped on January 19, 2018. Watch it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uGjCUY59B_0

songs.embed_content: Read “S.L.U.T.” by Bea Miller on Genius

songs.title: ​feel something

description.plain:
“feel something” talks about fear and anxiety in a person, where that person has reached a limit in life where people, even close people, cannot be trusted.

Bea tells us about when you have reached a point of your life where you can not feel any emotion or even pain or happiness, you feel empty inside, you just want to feel something, be it joy or sadness.

Bea talks about the song via Twitter:

i’ve been trying to cope with the mediocrity of life because recently it hasn’t been a sad experience but it hasn’t been a happy one either. i tried my best to put that into words almost selfishly because i wanted to know if i’m the problem or if we all go through it.

songs.embed_content: Read “​feel something” by Bea Miller on Genius
